result.execSummary:
The defendant LeRoy K Rushing Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 5 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Concurrent to present sentence.
Concurrent with: Present sentence

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 7/15/2016 Plea and Sentencing Hearing
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant LeRoy K Rushing in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
1 year without work release commencing today.  (Credit - 0 days).  Concurrent to any other sentence.  
COSTS:  $268.00 
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
Payments to be made within 90 days, failure to pay will result in 5 days jail consecutive.  
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from DCI.

Hearing on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
